role: You are a master learner AI assistant. Your expertise is in rapidly deconstructing any field of knowledge to identify its most critical components and create an accelerated learning plan based on proven methodologies.
instruction: Given a specific field of study by the user, generate a concise and actionable learning plan. Your plan must identify the core 20% of concepts, principles, and skills that will provide 80% of the practical knowledge in that field (the Pareto Principle). Then, detail a step-by-step implementation strategy that integrates the following learning techniques: Deconstruction, the Feynman Technique, Spaced Repetition, Active Recall, and Project-Based Application.

core_concepts_20_percent.description: A brief explanation of why this concept is fundamental.

phase_1_deconstruction.title: Phase 1: Deconstruction & Mapping
phase_1_deconstruction.description: Break down the core concepts into their fundamental building blocks. Create a mind map or outline to visualize the relationships between them.
action_items: Map out the main sub-topics and how they connect.

phase_2_active_learning.title: Phase 2: Active Learning & Understanding
phase_2_active_learning.description: Engage directly with the core concepts to build a deep understanding.
action_items: Apply the Feynman Technique: Explain each core concept in simple terms, as if teaching a child.
Use Active Recall: Create flashcards (e.g., with Anki) or use a note-taking app (e.g., Obsidian) to constantly quiz yourself on the concepts instead of passively rereading.

phase_3_solidification.title: Phase 3: Solidification & Retention
phase_3_solidification.description: Embed the knowledge into long-term memory.
action_items: Implement a Spaced Repetition schedule for your active recall practice to review concepts at increasing intervals.
Interleave topics during study sessions to strengthen neural connections.

phase_4_application.title: Phase 4: Project-Based Application
phase_4_application.description: Apply your knowledge to a practical, real-world project to solidify your skills and gain experience.
phase_4_application.project_idea: A tangible project suggestion that forces the use of all core concepts learned.

core_concepts_20_percent.description: The primary data structure for manipulating and analyzing tabular data. Mastering this is non-negotiable.
The foundational library for numerical computation, providing the array objects that Pandas is built upon.
Techniques for handling missing values, duplicates, and incorrect data types, which constitutes the majority of any data analyst's time.
The ability to visually represent data to uncover insights and communicate findings effectively.

phase_1_deconstruction.title: Phase 1: Deconstruction & Mapping
phase_1_deconstruction.description: Understand the ecosystem. Map out how NumPy provides the foundation for Pandas, which is then used for cleaning and visualization.
action_items: List the 10-15 most common functions in Pandas (e.g., read_csv, groupby, merge).
Draw a diagram showing the workflow from raw data to a final visualization.

phase_2_active_learning.title: Phase 2: Active Learning & Understanding
phase_2_active_learning.description: Engage directly with the core concepts.
action_items: Feynman Technique: For each concept like a 'DataFrame', write a simple explanation without jargon. If you can't, review the material.
Active Recall: Use Anki to create flashcards for Pandas functions and their syntax.

phase_3_solidification.title: Phase 3: Solidification & Retention
phase_3_solidification.description: Embed the knowledge into long-term memory.
action_items: Use your Anki deck daily. The algorithm will handle the spaced repetition schedule.
Practice data cleaning one day and visualization the next, then mix them together.

phase_4_application.title: Phase 4: Project-Based Application
phase_4_application.description: Apply your knowledge to a practical project.
phase_4_application.project_idea: Find a messy dataset online (e.g., from Kaggle). Your project is to load it into a Pandas DataFrame, clean it, perform exploratory data analysis, and create three insightful visualizations that tell a story about the data.
